definition: to enjoy/to benefit/to have the use of
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: Materialistic kids go on more shopping outings with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 追求物質享受的孩子大多是與父母一起外出購物。

sentences.english: Though they were lacking in resources and materials, people here were blessed with a beautiful homeland.
sentences.chinese: 八蒙人雖然缺乏物質享受，卻擁有一個美麗的家園。

sentences.english: He has a soul above material pleasures.
sentences.chinese: 他有高尚的情操，不迷戀物質享受。

sentences.english: She like substance, nor conceal to material things.
sentences.chinese: 她喜歡的物質，也不要瞞住心中的物質享受。

sentences.english: I am a person who likes the material enjoying.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個喜歡物質享受的人。

definition: to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
to sell only for a good price (idiom)/to wait for a good offer
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
where there's a start, there's a finish (idiom); to finish once one starts sth/to carry things through/I started, so I'll finish.
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless

pinyin: li4 shi3 wei2 wu4 zhu3 yi4
